1→# Claude Continue
     2→
     3→Minimal Claude CLI wrapper with automatic session continuation.
     4→
     5→## Usage
     6→
     7→```bash
     8→# Both --uri and --print are required
     9→tsx claude.ts --uri <directory> --print <prompt>
    10→
    11→# Examples
    12→tsx claude.ts --uri .claude --print "say hello"
    13→tsx claude.ts --uri /tmp/session --print "what's 2+2?"
    14→
    15→# Via npm
    16→npm run claude -- --uri .claude --print "your prompt"
    17→```
    18→
    19→## Features
    20→
    21→- Always uses `--output-format stream-json --verbose`
    22→- Automatically adds `--continue` when session exists
    23→- Saves conversation history to `<uri>/session.json`
    24→- Saves stream output to `<uri>/stream.jsonl` (append mode)
    25→- Maintains last 6 exchanges as context
    26→
    27→## Arguments
    28→
    29→- `--uri <directory>` - Required. Directory for session storage
    30→- `--print <prompt>` - Required. Your prompt to Claude
    31→
    32→## Files Created
    33→
    34→- `<uri>/session.json` - Conversation history
    35→- `<uri>/stream.jsonl` - Raw JSON stream (one JSON per line)
    36→
    37→## Implementation
    38→
    39→Single file: `claude.ts` (84 lines)

1→#!/usr/bin/env tsx
     2→import { spawn } from "child_process"
     3→import { readFile, writeFile, mkdir, appendFile } from "fs/promises"
     4→import { join } from "path"
     5→
     6→// Parse arguments
     7→export function parseArgs(args: string[]) {
     8→  const uriIndex = args.indexOf("--uri")
     9→  const printIndex = args.indexOf("--print")
    10→  
    11→  if (uriIndex === -1 || printIndex === -1) {
    12→    throw new Error("Usage: tsx claude.ts --uri <directory> --print <prompt>")
    13→  }
    14→  
    15→  const uri = args[uriIndex + 1]
    16→  const prompt = args.slice(printIndex + 1).join(" ")
    17→  
    18→  if (!uri || !prompt) {
    19→    throw new Error("Both --uri and --print are required")
    20→  }
    21→  
    22→  return { uri, prompt }
    23→}
    24→
    25→// Persistence layer
    26→export async function loadSession(dir: string) {
    27→  try {
    28→    return JSON.parse(await readFile(join(dir, "session.json"), "utf8"))
    29→  } catch {
    30→    return { h: [] }
    31→  }
    32→}
    33→
    34→export async function saveSession(dir: string, session: any) {
    35→  await mkdir(dir, { recursive: true })
    36→  await writeFile(join(dir, "session.json"), JSON.stringify(session, null, 2))
    37→}
    38→
    39→export async function appendStream(dir: string, line: string) {
    40→  await appendFile(join(dir, "stream.jsonl"), line + "\n")
    41→}
    42→
    43→export function buildPrompt(history: Array<[string, string]>, prompt: string): string {
    44→  if (history.length === 0) return prompt
    45→  const context = history.slice(-6).map(([r, c]) => `${r}: ${c}`).join("\n")
    46→  return `${context}\n\nUser: ${prompt}`
    47→}
    48→
    49→// Main function
    50→export async function main(args: string[]) {
    51→  const { uri, prompt } = parseArgs(args)
    52→  
    53→  // Load session
    54→  const session = await loadSession(uri)
    55→  
    56→  // Build prompt with context
    57→  const fullPrompt = buildPrompt(session.h, prompt)
    58→  
    59→  // Run claude
    60→  const cmd = ["--output-format", "stream-json", "--verbose", "--print", fullPrompt]
    61→  if (session.h.length) cmd.push("--continue")
    62→  
    63→  const proc = spawn("claude", cmd, { 
    64→    stdio: ["pipe", "pipe", "pipe"],
    65→    env: { ...process.env, CLAUDE_NON_INTERACTIVE: "1" }
    66→  })
    67→  
    68→  // Close stdin to signal we're not sending more input
    69→  proc.stdin.end()
    70→  let response = ""
    71→  
    72→  // Ensure directory exists for stream
    73→  await mkdir(uri, { recursive: true })
    74→  
    75→  // Handle spawn errors
    76→  proc.on("error", (err) => {
    77→    console.error("Failed to spawn claude:", err)
    78→    console.error("Make sure 'claude' CLI is installed and in PATH")
    79→    process.exit(1)
    80→  })
    81→  
    82→  // Process stream
    83→  let buffer = ""
    84→  proc.stdout.on("data", chunk => {
    85→    buffer += chunk.toString()
    86→    const lines = buffer.split("\n")
    87→    buffer = lines.pop() || "" // Keep incomplete line in buffer
    88→    
    89→    for (const line of lines.filter(Boolean)) {
    90→      console.log(line)
    91→      // Save stream line
    92→      appendStream(uri, line).catch(console.error)
    93→      
    94→      try {
    95→        const json = JSON.parse(line)
    96→        if (json.type === "assistant" && json.message?.content?.[0]?.text) {
    97→          response += json.message.content[0].text
    98→        }
    99→      } catch {}
   100→    }
   101→  })
   102→  
   103→  // Process any remaining buffer on close
   104→  proc.stdout.on("end", () => {
   105→    if (buffer.trim()) {
   106→      console.log(buffer)
   107→      appendStream(uri, buffer).catch(console.error)
   108→    }
   109→  })
   110→  
   111→  proc.stderr.on("data", chunk => {
   112→    process.stderr.write(chunk)
   113→  })
   114→  
   115→  await new Promise<number>(r => proc.on("exit", r))
   116→  
   117→  // Save session
   118→  if (response) {
   119→    session.h.push(["user", prompt], ["assistant", response])
   120→    await saveSession(uri, session)
   121→  }
   122→}
   123→
   124→// In-source tests only when NODE_TEST is set
   125→if (process.env.NODE_TEST === "1") {
   126→  (async () => {
   127→    const { test } = await import("node:test")
   128→    const assert = await import("node:assert/strict")
   129→  
   130→  test("parseArgs_valid_returnsUriAndPrompt", () => {
   131→    const result = parseArgs(["--uri", "test", "--print", "hello", "world"])
   132→    assert.equal(result.uri, "test")
   133→    assert.equal(result.prompt, "hello world")
   134→  })
   135→
   136→  test("parseArgs_missingUri_throwsError", () => {
   137→    assert.throws(
   138→      () => parseArgs(["--print", "test"]),
   139→      /Usage:/
   140→    )
   141→  })
   142→
   143→  test("parseArgs_missingPrint_throwsError", () => {
   144→    assert.throws(
   145→      () => parseArgs(["--uri", "test"]),
   146→      /Usage:/
   147→    )
   148→  })
   149→
   150→  test("parseArgs_emptyValues_throwsError", () => {
   151→    assert.throws(
   152→      () => parseArgs(["--uri", "", "--print", ""]),
   153→      /required/
   154→    )
   155→  })
   156→
   157→  test("buildPrompt_noHistory_returnsPrompt", () => {
   158→    const result = buildPrompt([], "hello")
   159→    assert.equal(result, "hello")
   160→  })
   161→
   162→  test("buildPrompt_withHistory_includesContext", () => {
   163→    const history: Array<[string, string]> = [
   164→      ["user", "hi"],
   165→      ["assistant", "hello"]
   166→    ]
   167→    const result = buildPrompt(history, "bye")
   168→    assert.ok(result.includes("user: hi"))
   169→    assert.ok(result.includes("assistant: hello"))
   170→    assert.ok(result.includes("User: bye"))
   171→  })
   172→
   173→  test("buildPrompt_longHistory_limitsToSix", () => {
   174→    const history: Array<[string, string]> = Array.from(
   175→      { length: 10 },
   176→      (_, i) => ["user", `msg${i}`]
   177→    )
   178→    const result = buildPrompt(history, "new")
   179→    assert.ok(result.includes("msg9"))
   180→    assert.ok(!result.includes("msg3"))
   181→  })
   182→  })()
   183→}
   184→
   185→// Execute main if run directly and not in test mode
   186→if (import.meta.url === `file://${process.argv[1]}` && process.env.NODE_TEST !== "1") {
   187→  main(process.argv.slice(2)).catch((err) => {
   188→    console.error(err.message)
   189→    process.exit(1)
   190→  })
   191→}
